interestingcomments.content:
Do you think that in the future, due to innovations in technology/AI and increased productivity, most of the population won’t have to be employed at all? /!/ Hundreds of years ago, one person farming only fed one person, but nowadays many people don’t have to work to have food, a result of agriculture and technology.

Do you think technology will reach a point where nearly every job (besides technology researchers and related fields) will be taken over by artificial intelligence? Even the ones that require ethics and reasoning, like philosophy and law?
